â
'''Necrophilia''' also called '''thanatophilia ''' and '''necrolagnia''' according to the ''[[Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders]]'', is a [[paraphilia]] characterized by a [[human sexuality|sexual]] attraction to [[corpse]]s. The word derives from Ancient Greek: ''Î½ÎµÎºÏÏÏ '' (''nekros''; "corpse," or "dead") + ÏÎ¹Î»Î¯Î± (''philia''; "love").
  â   â
Figuratively, the term "necrophilia" describes an inordinate desire to control another person, usually in the context of a [[romantic]] or interpersonal relationship; the accusation is that the person is so interpersonally controlling as to be better-suited to relationships with nonresponsive people.
    +
Figuratively, the term "necrophilia" describes an inordinate desire to control another person, usually in the context of a [[romantic]] or interpersonal relationship; the accusation is that the person is so interpersonally controlling as to be better-suited to relationships with nonresponsive people.{{fact}}
==Social, legal and psychological views on necrophilia==
==Social, legal and psychological views on necrophilia==
Line 20: Line 21:
===Serial killers===
===Serial killers===
Necrophilia has also been a motive for some [[serial killer]]s, including murderers [[Ed Gein]], [[Richard Chase]], [[Winston Moseley]], [[John Reginald Halliday Christie]], [[Bruno Ludke]], [[Jerry Brudos]], and [[Jeffrey Dahmer]], who ate his victims after killing them; the technical term for this particular variant activity is [[necrophagia]]. Several other [[murder]]ers have described drawing sexual excitement from killing, as well, such as [[Karla Faye Tucker]], who claimed to have an [[orgasm]] with each swing of the [[axe]] she used to kill [[Jerry Lynn Dean]]. The guilty-plea testimony provided by the recently captured ([[2005]]) serial killer [[Dennis Rader]] provided a rare public glimpse into the workings of such a controlling mind. Ballah Barco is also a known necrophiliac.
Necrophilia has also been a motive for some [[serial killer]]s, including murderers [[Ed Gein]], [[Richard Chase]], [[Winston Moseley]], [[John Reginald Halliday Christie]], [[Bruno Ludke]], [[Jerry Brudos]], and [[Jeffrey Dahmer]], who ate his victims after killing them; the technical term for this particular variant activity is [[necrophagia]]. Several other [[murder]]ers have described drawing sexual excitement from killing, as well, such as [[Karla Faye Tucker]], who claimed to have an [[orgasm]] with each swing of the [[axe]] she used to kill [[Jerry Lynn Dean]]. The guilty-plea testimony provided by the recently captured ([[2005]]) serial killer [[Dennis Rader]] provided a rare public glimpse into the workings of such a controlling mind. Ballah Barco is also a known necrophiliac.
â   â
==Necrophilia in Popular Culture==
  â   â
*In [[2002]], [[World Wrestling Entertainment]] ran the infamous [[Katie Vick]] [[angle (professional wrestling)|storyline]] as part of a [[feud (professional wrestling)|feud]] between [[Triple H]] and [[Glen Jacobs|Kane]]. In the storyline, Triple H accused Kane of killing Katie Vick, who had rejected Kane's romantic advances, and raping her corpse. Triple H also threatened to show footage of Kane's "crimes." Later, he showed the alleged footage, which cleverly showed Triple H dressed as Kane simulating an act of necrophilia on a mannequin dressed as Vick. The reaction from viewers and wrestling fans alike was so negative that WWE was forced to quickly end the storyline.
  â   â
*Also, some [[T-shirts]] have "Necrophilia: the overwhelming urge to crack open a cold one" written on them.
  â   â
*One of the characters of the [[webcomic]] [[Sexy Losers]], Shiunji Watanabe, is a necrophiliac who ends up working in a funeral home.
  â   â   â
===Necrophilia in fiction===
  â   â
While not necrophilia, [[Romanticism|romantic]] connections between [[romantic love|love]] and [[death]] are a frequent theme in [[Western culture|Western]] [[art]]istic expression.
  â   â
*In the Greek legend of the [[Trojan War]], the Greek hero [[Achilles]] slays the [[Amazons|Amazon]] queen [[Penthesilea]] in a duel. Upon removing her helmet and seeing her face, Achilles falls in love with her and mourns her death. The soldier [[Thersites]] openly ridicules Achilles and accuses him of necrophilia. Achilles responds by promptly killing Thersites with a single blow. ''(In some traditions, Thersites' accusation is not unfounded--Achilles was so stricken by Panthesilea's beauty that he could not control his lust for her, even after her death.)''
  â   â
*In [[Chuck Palahniuk]]'s [[Lullaby (book)|Lullaby]], the protagonist has intercourse with his wife, though unbeknownst to him, she is dead.
  â   â
*[[Edgar Allan Poe]] once described the death of a beautiful young woman to be one of the most [[beauty|beautiful]] images. (By this, he was not saying that it is a good thing for young women to die; to him [[melancholy]] and pain were sources of beauty.) Also, his poem ''[[Annabel Lee]]'' includes, towards the end, a necrophilic theme.
  â   â
*[[Algernon Swinburne]] wrote a frankly necrophilic poem, ''The Leper'', in which a man keeps the body of his former lover in his house: ''Love bites and stings me through, to see/Her keen face made of sunken bones./Her worn-off eyelids madden me,/That were shot through with purple once.''
  â   â
*[[Oscar Wilde]]'s scandalous play, ''[[Salome (play)|Salome]]'', based on the Biblical story of a Judean princess who performs the [[Dance of the Seven Veils]] for the [[Tetrarch]], [[Herod Antipas|Herod]], in exchange for the head of [[John the Baptist]]. When Salome finally receives the Christian prophet's head, she addresses it in an erotic monologue that has highly suggestive necrophiliac overtones. Various artistic depictions of the story, particularly in the work of [[Gustave Moreau]] and [[Aubrey Beardsley]], also hint at this subtext.
  â   â
*[[William Faulkner]]'s [[A Rose for Emily]] revolves around a debutante's necrophilia.
  â   â
*In [[2005]] New York-based author [[Supervert]] published the book [http://supervert.com/necrophilia_variations Necrophilia Variations], a literary monograph on the erotic attraction to corpses and death.
  â   â
*In [[Christopher Moore]]'s novel, [[Bloodsucking Fiends]], when the police find the vampire Jody in Tommy's freezer they think it's a dead body he's hiding so they send her to the morgue. The man working there is a necrophiliac and nearly molests her before she wakes up, giving him a heart attack that leads to his death. (She tucks his erection away so when he's found no one will suspect his dirty secret.)
  â   â
*In [[H.P. Lovecraft]]'s [[The Loved Dead]], with [[C. M. Eddy, Jr]], the protagonist's actions revolve around his misunderstood feelings towards dead people, starting with his own grandfather.
  â   â
An extension of the emotional connection between love and death is love for a person, which remains after death. Some [[ghost stories]] focus on a deceased person's undying love for a living individual, manifest literally in the form of a palpable [[ghost]] or [[poltergeist]]. While it is considered a romantic image for a person to die "in the arms" of a lover, sexual activity with the dead is usually considered [[taboo]], but has appeared in recent [[film]] and [[music]].
  â   â
''Resurrection erotica'' is a set of artistic sub-genres wherein a person is brought back from a nonresponsive state (death, or a coma) by an expression, sometimes graphically physical, of romantic or sexual love. An example of this in [[fairy tale]] is the [[Sleeping Beauty]] parable.
  â   â
===Necrophilia in film and television===
  â   â
* In [[1980]] artist John Duncan reportedly purchased a body and taped his sex act with it. [http://www.johnduncan.org/bd-essays.html Blind Date essay]
  â   â
*The 1985 cult horror film, ''[[Re-Animator]]'', loosely based on an [[H. P. Lovecraft]] story, contains an memorable instance of "reverse necrophilia". In the film, a decapitated surgeon is brought back to life and then sets about kidnapping and sexually molesting the nubile young daughter of the Dean of the Miskatonic medical school. The absurdity culminates in an ingeniously off-color slapstick-surreal [[double entendre]]: the "re-animated" surgeon holds out his severed head and attempts to perform [[cunnilingus]] on the daughter, who is now stripped, spread-eagled, and trussed to a table (i.e., the head literally "gives head").
  â   â
*The 1987 [[controversial]] [[Germany|German]] film ''[[Nekromantik]]'' offers a graphic portrayal of [[Paraphilia|sexual]] necrophilia.
  â   â
*In the [[1989]] comedy film ''[[Weekend at Bernie's]]'', the titular corpse's wife returns to his beachfront home and has sex with the corpse, not realizing that Bernie has been dead for days.
  â   â
*A [[1991]] ''[[Taggart]]'' episode, Nest of Vipers, featured a plotline where a necrophiliac used venomous animals to commit murders.
  â   â
*In the 1994 film ''[[Clerks.]]'', a girl mistakenly has sex with a dead man in a [[convenience store]] bathroom.
  â   â
*The [[1994]] film [[Aftermath (film)|Aftermath]] directed by [[Nacho CerdÃ ]] deals with necrophilia in a morgue.
  â   â
*The 1996 Canadian film ''[[Kissed]]'', starring [[Molly Parker]], deals heavily with necrophilia.
  â   â
*Also ''[[Tim Burton's Corpse Bride]]'' is a 2005 [[stop-motion animation|stop-motion-animation]] [[film]] about [[Marriage|marry]]ing the [[Dead]].
  â   â
*An episode of [[CSI: Miami|CSI: Miami]] centers about a moviemaker who mistakes a murder victim for a drunk and has intercourse with her on the beach
  â   â
===Necrophilia in music===
  â   â
*Satirical songwriter [[Tom Lehrer]], whose [[1950s]] recordings mentioned many topics not normally openly discussed in those days, referenced a friend of his who "wrote a heartwarming story about a young necrophiliac who finally achieved his lifelong ambition by becoming Coroner!" Lehrer gave the audience a few seconds to murmur in bewilderment, and then said, "The rest of you can look it up when you get home!"
  â   â
Several [[rock (music)|rock]] artists also focus on the connection between romantic love and death, despair, and the occult:
  â
*In the [[1970s]], shock rocker [[Alice Cooper]] recorded a couple of songs about necrophilia, "I Love the Dead", and "Cold Ethyl".
  â
*In [[Europe]], a notable example is [[HIM (band)|HIM]].
  â
*[[United States|American]] [[industrial rock]] band [[Stabbing Westward]] has many songs dealing with [[despair]], [[drug abuse]], [[sexual abuse]], [[death]], and [[romantic love]], often in conjunction.
  â
*[[Horror punk]] band [[The Misfits]] wrote a song called "Last Caress" which includes the lines "Sweet lovely death/ I am waiting for your breath/ Come Sweet Death, One Last Caress" Also covered by NoFX.
  â
*[[Rammstein]] wrote a song called ''Heirate mich'' (Marry me) in which a man digs up his dead girlfriend and "takes what's still there".
  â
*[[Horror punk]] band [[Murderdolls]], led by [[Wednesday 13]], has created a life style out of singing about necrophilia and sexual acts with the dead.
  â
*[[Punk rock]] band [[TSOL]] had a minor hit with "Code Blue", a song that justifies necrophilia by claiming (among other things) that the singer can, "Do what I want and [she] won't complain."
  â
* The [[Rockabilly]] subgenre of [[Psychobilly]] is full of bands who sing of necrophilia as a main staple of their music. A strong example of this is the song "Nekrophiliac" by Danish psychobillies [[Nekromantix]].
  â
*In the [[1980s]] and [[1990s]], necrophilia emerged in the [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]] sub-genres of [[death metal]], [[black metal]] and [[goregrind]].
  â
*In [[1993]], a [[music video]] for [[Tom Petty]]'s hit song "[[Mary Jane's Last Dance]]" featured the singer simulating various romantic poses with a dead woman (played by [[Kim Basinger]]).
  â
*In [[1996]], a [[Russia]]n band called ''[[Sexual Minorities]]'' ("Ð¡ÐµÐºÑÑÐ°Ð»ÑÐ½ÑÐµ Ð¼ÐµÐ½ÑÑÐ¸Ð½ÑÑÐ²Ð°" in [[Russian (language)|Russian]]) released the album titled ''Necrophilia - The Cold Ten'' (in Russian, "ÐÐµÐºÑÐ¾ÑÐ¸Ð»Ð¸Ñ - Ð¥Ð¾Ð»Ð¾Ð´Ð½Ð°Ñ ÐÐµÑÑÑÐºÐ°"), which contained parodies of Russian pop-songs.
  â
*In [[2000 in music|2000]] [[Comedian]] [[Stephen Lynch (comedian)|Stephen Lynch]] released a song called ''A Month Dead'' about a necrophiliac who's lover is beginning to smell on his only studio album to date entitled ''[[A Little Bit Special]].''
  â
*In [[2003]] the Colorado based humor-horror punk band [[Crackula]] recorded a song entitled "NecroFeelin'" about a necrophilic love affair.
  â
*British Grindcore band [[Raging Speedhorn]] wrote a song called "Necrophiliac glue-sniffer".
  â
*Many of the songs written by the [[death metal]] band [[Cannibal Corpse]] involve necrophilia.
  â
*''[[Mikelangelo and the Black Sea Gentlemen]]'' mention necrophilia in their song "Formidable Marinade" on the album ''Journey through the Sea of Shadows''
  â
*''[[Slayer]]'' released a song on their ''Hell Awaits'' Album called "Necrophiliac".
  â
*[[Death metal]] band ''[[Cannibal Corpse]]'' released a song called Necropedophile
  â
*''[[Brotha Lynch Hung]]'', a hardcore rapper from Sacramento is one of the most gruesome and explicitally violent lyricists with songs graphically chronicling a life filled by drug use and sale, promiscuity, ultra-violence, rape, infanticide, necrophilia, and cannibalism.
  â
*''[[Wolfpac]]'' a [[horrorcore]] rap group released a song called Death Becomes Her about having sex with a dead girl and eventually having to hide the body from the police.
  â
*''[[Insane Clown Posse]]'' released a song entitled "Cemetary Girl". In the song [[Violent J]] digs up his dead girlfriend.
  â
*''[[Sam Bakley and the Grave Robbers]]'' With lyrics based totaly on necrophilia and high school health class this band never quite made it to a major record deal
 
==Among animals==
==Among animals==
â  
Necrophilia is not unknown in animals, with a number of confirmed observations. Kees Moeliker made one of these observations while he was sitting in his office at the Natuurmuseum Rotterdam, when he heard the distinctive thud of a bird hitting the glass facade of the building. Upon inspection, he discovered a drake mallard lying dead about two meters from the building. Next to the downed bird there was a second drake mallard standing close by. As he observed the odd couple, the living drake picked at the corpse of the dead one for a few minutes and then, without provocation, it mounted the corpse and began copulating with it. The act of necrophilia lasted for about 75 minutes, in which time, according to Moeliker, the living drake took two short breaks before resuming with copulating behavior. Moeliker surmised that at the time of the collision with the window the two mallards were engaged in a common motif in [[duck]] behavior which is called [[rape flight]]. "When one died the other one just went for it and didn't get any negative feedback -- well, didn't get any feedback," according to Moeliker. This is the first recorded case of [[Homosexual necrophilia in the mallard duck]].
Necrophilia is not unknown in animals, with a number of confirmed observations. Kees Moeliker made one of these observations while he was sitting in his office at the Natuurmuseum Rotterdam, when he heard the distinctive thud of a bird hitting the glass facade of the building. Upon inspection, he discovered a drake mallard lying dead about two meters from the building. Next to the downed bird there was a second drake mallard standing close by. As he observed the odd couple, the living drake picked at the corpse of the dead one for a few minutes and then, without provocation, it mounted the corpse and began copulating with it. The act of necrophilia lasted for about 75 minutes, in which time, according to Moeliker, the living drake took two short breaks before resuming with copulating behavior. Moeliker surmised that at the time of the collision with the window the two mallards were engaged in a common motif in [[duck]] behavior which is called [[rape flight]]. "When one died the other one just went for it and didn't get any negative feedback -- well, didn't get any feedback," according to Moeliker. This is the first recorded case of [[Homosexual necrophilia in the mallard duck]].
